title: Songs of Praise presenter Diane Louise Jordan: ‘I earned £1.50 a day – now I book entire hotels’
text:
Diane Louise Jordan, 59, trained and worked as an actress before joining Blue Peter in 1990, becoming its first black presenter. She left the series in 1996 and since 2007 has hosted BBC One’s Songs of Praise.

Jordan is currently appearing in the Channel 4 show Sink Or Swim for Stand Up To Cancer. She lives in Cambridgeshire with her husband, violinist Giles Broadbent.

How did your upbringing affect your attitude towards money?

My parents were Jamaican immigrants who came to Britain in the Fifties. Our first home was two rooms in Golders Green, London, but my dad badgered to get us on the council list and we were eventually given a three-bedroom house in Hatfield, Hertfordshire.
